content:
people seem to have a hard time to understand the interface, if they are new to zulip

i try to understand their problems....

one thing coming to my mind is - in this compose dialogue, on the upper left about this textbox, there is the stream name shown.
when the stream is private, the lock-symbol is being shown. when the stream is world-public, the world-symbol is shown.

why not show "#" symbol when the stream is regular/public(with login)? that would make it easier for newbies to recognize that this field shows the streams from the list on the left

furthermore - why that extra bar on the left for the stream color? if only symbols would be used, you could use the symbol color, like in the list on the left.

with the existing way it looks inconsistent to me and probably more complicated as needed

if you want to have this consistent with the labels , at least add that "#" icon everywhere where a stream is being mentioned - in the same way you add the world icon and the lock icon. that would make life for newbies easier, as the just see that it's another mention of the stream name from the left

RolandK said:

people seem to have a hard time to understand the interface, if they are new to zulip

i try to understand their problems....

Thank you, that's super helpful!

why not show "#" symbol when the stream is regular/public(with login)? that would make it easier for newbies to recognize that this field shows the streams from the list on the left

We definitely should! I think it'll be fixed as part of #23355 -- @Evy, is that right?

In general, I've been filing issues any time I notice a stream name in the app without a stream symbol preceding it. So if anyone spots more places like that, please report it as an issue if we don't already have one.

furthermore - why that extra bar on the left for the stream color? if only symbols would be used, you could use the symbol color, like in the list on the left.

We are working on redesigning the compose box; please see #design > UI redesign: compose box for the latest proposal. The color bar will be removed in favor of a colored stream type symbol.
